About Me

Im a 22 year old web developer, with a passion for solving problems and taking on new challenges. In my spare time I like to ride my motorcycle, code, garden, and tinker with new DIY mechanical and electrical problems. In the next few years, I want be creating video games, buying and improving rental properties, and brewing my own beer.

I'm availiable to hire! I'm open to direct hire, contract to hire, contract, and freelance opportunity's. My unique background and world experiences put's me apart from my peers. I'd love to get together and talk over a coffee or beer. Email or call me anytime!

I taught Kamon during an 18 week full-stack JavaScript bootcamp at Enspiral Dev Academy, New Zealand. He travelled halfway around the world to attend, demonstrated considerable resilience and enthusiasm for the work, and was a delight to have as part of the team there. His technical aptitude is solid, with a curiosity for new technology and concepts that will serve him very well. He fits into teams easily, is not shy in voicing his opinion but works to find a shared common solution. I would not hesitate in recommending him for any development position.
- Rich Churcher, Software developer at Hylo

Kamon came to New Zealand to study at Enspiral Dev Academy, into a new environment & new culture and embraced the situtation with a very positive attitude. He found it easy making friends with everyone in the cohort and was a valuable partner in our coding exercises. We became close over the 9 weeks of the intensive bootcamp as our personalities gelled well together and he would be the first person I would reach out to when I ran into coding problems. He was quick on the uptake of new libraries and frameworks, and was able to help explain how to best use these tools in our projects. I would happily work again with Kamon in the future.
- Erwin Hessing, Software Developer at Conqa
